task_summary: The robot locates, approaches, and turns a knob, as depicted in the nine contact-sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode tasks a stationary manipulator robot with turning a green knob attached to a blue/yellow fixture on a table. The robot must visually identify the knob, approach and align its end effector to the knob, then turn it clockwise (direction inferred from continuous hand motion in frames). The robot's arm is the only actuator, and the action occurs without interruptions or tool changes.
preconditions: Knob is visible and reachable on the table
Robot is powered on, in start position
No obstacles block the robot's path
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the knob precisely
Turn the knob clockwise by ~90 degrees, low force
success_criteria: Knob is turned to new orientation (visible displacement in frames 4-8)
Robot arm returns to neutral after turning
failure_and_recovery: Approach/align fails: adjust pose or timeout
Knob resists turning: limit applied force, abort early on slip
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after successful TurnKnob action; knob orientation is visibly changed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detect the knob to localize its position for manipulation.
Move and align the end effector precisely to the knob.
Turn the knob clockwise 90 degrees with minimal required force.

failure_modes: Knob jams or excessive force needed
recovery_strategy: Retry detection if knob not found
Abort or reduce force if resistance is detected
assumptions: The knob is clearly visible and free of occlusion in all frames.
Turning direction is inferred as clockwise (frames show rightward motion of knob, not explicitly stated in instruction).
Angle turned is 90 degrees, matching the robot's continuous arm motion from pre-turn to post-turn; true value is visually estimated.
‘Low force’ mapped to minimum allowed force_limit.

expected_success_criteria: Knob visibly turns 90 degrees from initial orientation
No slippage or error during turning
